metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2779 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
runuser in util-linux allows local users to escape to the parent session via a crafted TIOCSTI ioctl call, which pushes characters to the terminal's input buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdutils - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

fdisk - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
libblkid1 - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
libfdisk1 - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
libmount1 - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
libsmartcols1 - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
libuuid1 - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
mount - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
rfkill - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
setpriv - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
util-linux - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
util-linux-locales - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
uuid-runtime - 2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 2.31 introduced a --pty option that can be used eslerm> upstream revereted their patch backporting 2.31's optional --pty flag has high risk potential

criterions.comment: util-linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.31.1-0.4ubuntu3.3').
